Description: Fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery lid. Glazed interior. On the exterior a panther to left, much of its forepart and part of its head remaining; above, an incised rosette
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 20, no. 67 pl. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.570)
